intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: What's this, then? The exalt herself, in all her radiance? I fear I must shield my eyes! Bwa ha ha ha!

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: King Gangrel, I've come for the truth of this unfortunate incident between us.

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: The truth? I can give you the truth.

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: Perhaps milady might first share her name?

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: You may call me Aversa.

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: Very well, Aversa. Is Maribelle unharmed?

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Who? Oh yes, that little blonde brat.

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: Unhand me, you gutter-born troglodyte!

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Maribelle!

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: Lissa? Darling, is that you?

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: This girl crossed the Plegian border without our consent. And what's more... She wounded the brave Plegian soldiers who sought only to escort her safely home.

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: LIES! You speak nothing but lies, hag! Did they not teach the meaning of the word "truth" in wretched-crone school?!

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: ...You see? No manners at all. Such a nasty little bird simply had to be caged.

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Such a violent temper speaks to her guilt. This will call for a weighty punishment. And if she were to later confess to being an Ylissean spy? My goodness! It would take an act of CONSIDERABLE good faith to repair our relations.

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: I have done nothing wrong! It is they who should confess! They are the ones who invaded Ylisse. They razed an entire village! When I attempted to intervene, they took me and dragged me across the border. Let the plundered shops and charred homes of that village serve as my proof!

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: That would only prove Ylisse has a bandit problem—something I hear oft of late... But indeed, tonight I shall weep salty tears into my pillow for your dead villagers.

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: Your Grace, please!

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: Peace, Maribelle. I believe you. King Gangrel, I request that you release this woman at once. Surely you and I can sort out these affairs without the need of hostages.

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Without so much as an apology? Why should I even bother with parley? I'm within my rights to have her head this instant and be home in time for supper.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: You black-hearted devil!

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Control your dog, my dear, before he gets someone hurt.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Rrgh…

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Now then, Your Graceliness. Perhaps we can arrange a trade? You give me the Fire Emblem, and I return Mari Contrary here in one piece.

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: You would ask for Ylisse's royal treasure? But why?

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Because I know the legend! The Fire Emblem is the key to having all one's wishes realized. I have desired it for years. YEARS! ...Yet my birthday comes and goes each year, and nothing from Ylisse. Heheh…

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: The Emblem's power is meant for a single purpose, King Gangrel: to save the world and its people at their hour of most desperate need. Would you claim a more noble wish?

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: I want what every Plegian wants—a grisly end for every last Ylissean! What could be more noble than that?

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Surely you have not forgotten what the last exalt did to my people? Your father named us heathens! His "crusade" across Plegia butchered countless of my subjects and my kin!

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: ...I have never denied Ylisse's past wrongdoings. But I have sworn to never repeat those mistakes. Ours is now a realm of peace.

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Yours is now a haven of hypocrisy! Now give me the Fire Emblem!

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: No, Your Grace! I'd sooner die than act as a bargaining chip for this filthy reprobate!

intro.speaker: Emmeryn
intro.line: No, Maribelle…

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Ugh... Taaaaaalk talk-talk-talk-talk. It's time to speak louder than words! This negotiation is over, Your Luminosity! I shall have the Emblem if I have to pry it from your shiny dead hands!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Stay back! Or you'll all suffer the same fate!

intro.speaker: Gangrel
intro.line: Now that's a declaration of war if I've ever heard one... A big, messy war that will bleed you Ylisseans dry. Bwa ha ha!

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: Poor, stupid girl... Are you really worth fighting a war over? Years from now, you'll be remembered only as she who destroyed House Ylisse.

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: No... That's not... Oh, Lissa... Please, no…

intro.speaker: Ricken
intro.line: Maribelle! Go! You're free!

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: RICKEN?! What are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Ricken
intro.line: Just run! We can talk about it later!

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: Oh, is this your little boyfriend? Isn't he just precious.

intro.speaker: Ricken
intro.line: Don't talk down to me, witch!

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: Nngh! W-wind magic?

intro.speaker: Ricken
intro.line: Come on, Maribelle!

intro.speaker: Maribelle
intro.line: Right!

intro.speaker: Aversa
intro.line: Wretched whelp! I should... No. Our soldiers have them outnumbered. The brats will be dead long before they can reach their comrades.

battle.speaker: Gangrel
battle.line: Bwa ha ha! I have my war! Captain Orton! Remain here, and take down as many Ylisseans as you can. You can expect reinforcements from the forts as well. Now, do your best—at doing your worst! Bwa ha!

boss.speaker: Orton
boss.line: I won't ask for your name. Only your life!

boss.speaker: Orton
boss.line: This matters not. Soon war will be upon...your soil... Heh heh...

end.speaker: Maribelle
end.line: Nothing I didn't return twofold, darling.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Yes. I know you're not especially fond of me, but it's a relief just the same.

end.speaker: Maribelle
end.line: Oh, it's not a question of fondness. I am simply protective of Lissa. My treasure is very sensitive, and... Wait. Am I really justifying myself to a commoner? Gods... Yes, well, I do...apologize for being curt. And... And... And you have my thanks for your part in the rescue. There, I said it!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Forgive me, Emm. I acted rashly.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: It's all right, Chrom. King Gangrel is the one at fault here. You were only protecting me.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The Mad King will be rallying his forces, if they have not mobilized already. I suggest we make haste back to Ylisstol and discuss our strategy.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Of course, Frederick. It seems war is upon us. We must protect the Ylissean people at all costs.
